## mutInMany variable

Similar to [mutIn](./paths.mutin.md)<!-- -->, but takes any number of path-value pairs as args and applies them in sequence using `mutIn()`<!-- -->. All key paths must already be present in the given data structure until their penultimate key.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
mutInMany: (state: any, ...pairs: any[]) => any
```

## Remarks

Unlike [mutIn](./paths.mutin.md)<!-- -->, this function does not use type checked paths.

## Example


```ts
mutInMany(
  { a: { b: 1 }, x: { y: { z: 2 } } },
  "a.b", 10,
  "x.y.z", 20
)
// { a: { b: 10 }, x: { y: { z: 20 } } }

```
